definition: to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Positions continued price stability decreasing, and every higher up the action alone.
sentences.chinese: 價穩持倉量續遞減，多單有逢高回吐動作。

sentences.english: Profit-taking is likely next week as swine flu will weigh on investor sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 下週獲利回吐很可能因爲豬流感，將加重投資者情緒。

sentences.english: So, it should not be surprising to see some profit taking efforts in the coming days.
sentences.chinese: 因此，未來幾天出現一些獲利回吐盤不足爲奇。

to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
